Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets lead 1-0 in a three-game series against the Arizona Diamondbacks.
Arizona is 37-27 at home and 75-57 overall. The Diamondbacks have gone 37-13 in games when they hit at least two home runs.
New York is 34-30 in road games and 69-63 overall. Mets hitters have a collective.420 slugging percentage to rank ninth in MLB.
The teams meet Wednesday for the sixth time this season. The Mets are ahead 3-2 in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Corbin Carroll has 16 doubles, 12 triples, 15 home runs and 55 RBI for the Diamondbacks. Lourdes Gurriel Jr. is 12-for-33 with two doubles, two home runs and eight RBI over the last 10 games.
Pete Alonso leads New York with 28 home runs while slugging.470. Francisco Lindor is 15-for-42 with four home runs and eight RBI over the past 10 games.
Diamondbacks: 6-4,.249 batting average, 4.49 ERA, outscored opponents by 10 runs in the last 10 games.
Mets: 6-4,.235 batting average, 3.37 ERA, outscored opponents by nine runs in the last 10 games.
Injuries: Diamondbacks have several key players on the IL, including Ketel Marte, Bryce Jarvis, Gabriel Moreno, Christian Walker, Kyle Nelson, and Drey Jameson.
Mets have injuries to Paul Blackburn, Kodai Senga, Christian Scott, Drew Smith, Brooks Raley, Sean Reid-Foley, and Ronny Mauricio.
